bibl.title: Isis in Roman Dakhleh: Goddess of the Village, the Province, and the Country.
bibl.note: Introduction. - Isis in the Mortuary Beliefs of Dakhleh. - Isis in the Temple Decoration of the Oasis. - The Gegengabe of Isis. - Evidence for the Cultic Veneration of Isis in the Temple Decoration. - Evidence for the Cultic Veneration of Isis in Sources other than the Temple Decoration. - Evidence for Veneration of Isis from Domestic Contexts. - Conclusions.

bibl.title: Isis on the Nile. Egyptian Gods in Hellenistic and Roman Egypt. Proceedings of the IVth International Conference of Isis Studies, Liège, November 27-29, 2008. Michel Malaise in honorem

bibl.seg: KAPER Olaf E., Isis in Roman Dakhleh: Goddess of the Village, the Province, and the Country.

Laurent BRICAULT and Miguel John VERSLUYS (Edd.), Isis on the Nile. Egyptian Gods in Hellenistic and Roman Egypt. Proceedings of the IVth International Conference of Isis Studies, Liège, November 27-29, 2008. Michel Malaise in honorem = Religions in the Graeco-Roman World. 171 (Leiden, 2010) pp. 149-180, 5 tabl. et 13 figg.

Introduction. - Isis in the Mortuary Beliefs of Dakhleh. - Isis in the Temple Decoration of the Oasis. - The Gegengabe of Isis. - Evidence for the Cultic Veneration of Isis in the Temple Decoration. - Evidence for the Cultic Veneration of Isis in Sources other than the Temple Decoration. - Evidence for Veneration of Isis from Domestic Contexts. - Conclusions.
